metadata.feature_description: Shows most popular content across the community with view counts and engagement metrics

steps.expected: Successfully logged in and PersonaBar visible
steps.actual: Successfully logged in as SuperUser Account, PersonaBar visible on left sidebar

steps.action: Navigate to Dashboard > Community Analytics from PersonaBar
steps.expected: Community Analytics dashboard loads with Popular Content section
steps.actual: Panel appears but remains completely blank. JavaScript error in console: 'TypeError: utility.serializeCustomDate is not a function at dashboardClass.init'

issues: CRITICAL BUG: Community Analytics module fails to initialize due to JavaScript error
Error: TypeError: utility.serializeCustomDate is not a function
The utility.serializeCustomDate function is undefined, blocking the dashboardClass.init method from executing

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View popular content for different time periods

steps.action: Attempted to access time period controls in Community Analytics
steps.expected: Time period dropdown/controls visible to filter popular content
steps.actual: Cannot test - Community Analytics dashboard fails to load due to JavaScript error

issues: Cannot test due to Community Analytics module initialization failure
JavaScript error prevents dashboard from rendering any content

steps.action: Attempted to access pagination controls for popular content
steps.expected: Pagination controls (prev/next) visible to navigate through content results
steps.actual: Cannot test - Community Analytics dashboard fails to load due to JavaScript error

issues: Cannot test due to Community Analytics module initialization failure
Code shows pageActivities.js component has pagination controls but they never render

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Click through to actual content items

steps.action: Attempted to click on popular content items to navigate to them
steps.expected: Clicking on content items navigates to the actual content page
steps.actual: Cannot test - No content items displayed because Community Analytics fails to load

issues: Cannot test due to Community Analytics module initialization failure

steps.action: Attempted to verify view counts displayed for popular content
steps.expected: View counts displayed accurately for each content item
steps.actual: Cannot test - No view counts displayed because Community Analytics fails to load

issues: Cannot test due to Community Analytics module initialization failure

steps.action: Attempted to verify content is sorted by popularity metrics
steps.expected: Content displayed in order of popularity (most views/engagement first)
steps.actual: Cannot test - No content displayed because Community Analytics fails to load

issues: Cannot test due to Community Analytics module initialization failure

steps.action: Attempted to compare popular content across different time periods
steps.expected: Comparative data shows changes in content popularity between periods
steps.actual: Cannot test - Community Analytics dashboard fails to load

issues: Cannot test due to Community Analytics module initialization failure
API endpoint GetPopularContent supports comparativeTerm parameter but UI never loads

steps.action: Attempted to view popular content filtered by different content types
steps.expected: Popular content shown for various types (articles, blog posts, forum topics, etc.)
steps.actual: Cannot test - Community Analytics dashboard fails to load

issues: Cannot test due to Community Analytics module initialization failure

observations: CRITICAL: Community Analytics module completely fails to initialize due to a missing JavaScript function
Error Details: TypeError: utility.serializeCustomDate is not a function at dashboardClass.init (social-dashboard-combined-instance.js:1025:39)
The utility object exists but does not have the serializeCustomDate method defined
This appears to be a dependency issue where the utility module is not properly loading or is missing the serializeCustomDate function
Code review shows CommunityAnalyticsController.cs has proper API endpoints including GetPopularContent with pagination, period filtering, and comparative term support
Code review shows pageActivities.js has pagination controls (prev/next) and empty state handling, but these never render due to the initialization failure
Site Analytics module (same Dashboard section) also shows a warning about Google Analytics not being enabled, but at least loads its UI
This is a blocking bug that prevents any testing of the Popular Content Analytics feature
